title: Sans Serif + Slab
content:
Do you know the name of these fonts or something that similar, thank you very much.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Sans Serif 01.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023121122/http:/typophile.com/files/Sans%20Serif%2001.jpg) | 53.88 KB |
| [Slab 01.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023121122/http:/typophile.com/files/Slab%2001.jpg) | 58.29 KB |
author: manukball

comments.content: Slab (maybe rather just a serif): Joanna Semibold Italic
Sans is very like Antique Olive Bold Condensed. But different too.

The sans seems to be [  
Florida TS-Black](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023121122/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/ef-typeshop/florida/) (at least WTF says so).
Thank you very much Jan and acejet170

<cite>Florida TS-Black</cite>:  
Nice knockoff of [Flyer black](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023121122/http:/www.fonts.com/DE/detail.htm?pid=201900), Jan :-)

Interestingly, the knockoffs get better and more versatile than the originals - a tendency in typography since FF DIN.

Andreas

:-)

I’ve never seen that weight of Flyer.  
Oh well, now there are two to choose from.
